newsitem.title: MACEDONIA: Macedonia to get $60 mln EU loan next week.
newsitem.headline: Macedonia to get $60 mln EU loan next week.

text.p: The European Union Council of Ministers will approve on July 22 a $60 million loan to Macedonia to support its macro-financial policy, Macedonian deputy prime minister Zlatka Popovska said on Friday.
"The (42 million Ecu) credit is to be extended by the end of the year," she told a news conference.

The first 25 million Ecu instalment is planned for September but is conditioned with repayment of a Macedonian 27 million Ecu debt to the European Investment Bank. The second instalment is planned for October or November.
The credit with a 10-year grace period will be repaid in 15 years and carries interest equal to LIBOR plus 0.5 percent.
"The credit is to financially support our country and will enable us to fulfil our obligations to the Investment Bank as soon as possible," said Popovska.

She insisted the credit will help implement the cooperation protocol on 150 million Ecus, which automatically ensues after signing a cooperation agreement with the EU. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom, +389 91 201 196
